definition: to close a case/to bring a case to a close (law)
to melt (metal)/to cancel or annul/to sell/to spend/to fasten with a bolt/bolt or pin
to conclude a case/to wind up
to register (to an official organism)/to file a case (for investigation)
to give oneself up/to surrender (to the authorities)
release from custody, subject to provision of a surety, pending investigation (PRC)
to settle privately/to solve behind closed doors/to settle out of court
to set a time limit/time limit/deadline
to transfer (a case, a person, files etc)
to reduce penalty/shortened or commuted (judicial) sentence
to examine a wound or injury (typically for forensic purposes)
report the loss to the authorities concerned
